permissions.copyright-holder: SAGE/ Association Internationale de Méthodologie Sociologique

body.p: Full presentations of many of the entries below have already been distributed to BMS subscribers and RC33 members over the BMS-RC33 distribution list 1

sec.title: BMS & Sage Publications
sec.p: Those who have received email announcements via the BMS-RC33 distribution list have often seen the logo “[bms-rc33] Call -...” Now that the BMS has joined Sage Publications, the lag time between final acceptance and publication jumps from one month to three months, and we must establish a consequential backlog, particularly of research articles in English, so you are strongly encouraged to submit your interesting methodological articles to the BMS and to encourage your colleagues or student to do the same.

Our BMS “Information for authors” can be found on the BMS Web site at Sage (bms.sagepub.com). Please keep us in mind even when participating in the different sociological research conferences often announced here in the BMS or via our distribution lists.

sec.title: Some Past BMS-RC33 List Calls
sec.p:
Detailed information has already been distributed by our BMS-RC33 list (bms-rc33@services.cnrs) concerning the following:
Assistant Professor of Sociology, University of Turku, Finland, hanruona@utu.fi or pekras@utu.fi
4 Full Professor Posts in Sociological Methods, Göthe Universität, Frankfurt an Main, http://www.uni-frankfurt.de/aktuelles/ausschreibung/professuren/index.html
Post Doctoral/Assistant Professor, CEPS/INSTEAD Luxembourg, http://www.ceps.lu
Chapters for Memory and Data Banks Book, packardn@prodigy.net
Full Professor in Methods, University of Mannheim, http://jobs.sowi.uni-mannheim.de/
RC33 Conference Session Proposals, 9-13 July 2011, Sydney, https://surveys.acspri.org.au/callforsessionconvenors
Chapters for Online Panel Surveys: An Interdisciplinary Approach, online.panels.wiley@gmail.com
Sociology Professor, University of Sydney, catriona.elder@sydney.edu.au or rodney.waterson@sydney.edu.au
Post Doctorate in Innovation, Evolution & Complexity Theory, Eindhoven University, http://ecis.ieis.tue.nl/
Two Professor in Sociology and Methods Posts, Eberhard Karls Universität, Tübingen, dekanat@wiso.uni-tuebingen.de
